body_html:
I assume it's because the working directory isn't what the test expects. (It looks like the similar code image_ops_test.py isn't running as part of the Windows build because it's in python/ops rather than python/kernel_tests.)

As a quick workaround, you might try adding WORKING_DIRECTORY ${tensorflow_source_dir} to this line and see if it fixes things.
body_text:
I assume it's because the working directory isn't what the test expects. (It looks like the similar code image_ops_test.py isn't running as part of the Windows build because it's in python/ops rather than python/kernel_tests.)
As a quick workaround, you might try adding WORKING_DIRECTORY ${tensorflow_source_dir} to this line and see if it fixes things.
body:
I assume it's because the working directory isn't what the test expects. (It looks like the similar code `image_ops_test.py` isn't running as part of the Windows build because it's in `python/ops` rather than `python/kernel_tests`.)

As a quick workaround, you might try adding `WORKING_DIRECTORY ${tensorflow_source_dir}` to [this line](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/9d5c3b35f59c42445a0d1e01d46e606d27ae6f7c/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_tests.cmake#L102) and see if it fixes things.
